p: Although it is an effective antiseptic, PVP-I may not be optimal for pregnant women and children though. Hypothyroidism has in fact been reported with povidone-iodine antiseptics in neonates. Furthermore, transmission of SARS-COV-2 to breastfeeding infants through close contact with an asymtpomatic mother has been reported ( Jafari et al., 2020). Transient hyper-thyrotropinemia can occur in neonates whose mothers had been exposed to povidone-iodine as a skin disinfectant during and after labour ( Casteels et al., 2000).
